radiographic_examinations.findings: Indicated signs of infection with the presence of granulation tissue in the echogenic lesions.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient initially demonstrated tenderness and pain, which progressed to showing increased white blood cell count and C-reactive protein levels necessitating surgical intervention.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Delayed intraoperative indocyanine green uptake indicated issues in perfusion for some flaps.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Clinical correlations showed that delayed perfusion led to postoperative complications in two flaps, one resulting in venous congestion.
